page_1.text: Commercial dog foods are formulated to meet the dietary needs of dogs. The key to ensuring these foods provide all essential nutrients is to look for the Association of American Feed Control Officials (AAFCO) statement on pet food packaging.

text.statement: "(Name of food) is formulated to meet the nutritional levels established by the AAFCO Dog Food Nutrient Profiles for (life stage)."
text.explanation: This means that the food is complete and balanced for a particular life stage.

Adult Maintenance.text: These foods are intended for adult dogs.

Growth and Reproduction.text: These foods are designed for puppies and pregnant or lactating females.

dog_foods.text: Both dry and wet dog foods can provide complete nutrition for dogs, but they come with different benefits depending on a dogâ€™s preferences, health conditions, and lifestyle.

benefits.title: Dry Food Benefits
bullets: Can be used in food puzzles to enhance mental stimulation

benefits.title: Wet Food Benefits
bullets: Helps dogs feel fuller longer, aiding in weight loss

dog_foods.advice: Always consult with a veterinarian to determine the best dietary choices for your dog.
